body:
I made a small mistake in my patch. The correct test should be `first.html_safe?` instead of `first.is_a?(SafeBuffer)`.

A clearer version, for those interested, which should be quite efficient too:

    def join_with_safe_buffer_awareness(sep = $,)
      if first.html_safe?
        sep = sep.html_safe? ? sep : ERB::Util.h(sep)
        safe = map{|o| o.html_safe? ? o : ERB::Util.h(o)}
        safe.join_without_safe_buffer_awareness(sep).html_safe
      else
        join_without_safe_buffer_awareness(sep)
      end
    end



@wycats: Isn't that a slightly different semantic than your previous example (i.e. does your constructor take a string, or an array, or both?) In any case, I think it's backwards, and `Hash[...]` is the only Ruby example I can think of that is similar (and I still hope to remedy to that!)
